SEARCH
Package pl.polsl.lab1.oliwier.gebczynski.myfirstmvp.model

Class Snake

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab1.oliwier.gebczynski.myfirstmvp.model.Snake
public class Snake extends Object
The Snake class represents the snake in the Snake game. It maintains the position and movement of the snake, as well as its growth when eating candy. The snake is represented as a LinkedList of points, where each point corresponds to a part of the snake's body.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Oliwier Gebczynski

    Constructs a new Snake with an initial position and direction.

  • Constructor Details

    • Snake

      public Snake()
      Constructs a new Snake with an initial position and direction. The snake's body initially contains one point at (7, 7), and its direction is set to (1, 0) (moving right).

  • Method Details

    • getBody

      public LinkedList<Point> getBody()
      Returns the LinkedList representing the entire body of the snake. The head of the snake is the first point in the list.
      Returns:
      a LinkedList of Points representing the snake's body

    • getHead

      public Point getHead()
      Returns the position of the snake's head. The head is the first point in the body list.
      Returns:
      the position of the snake's head

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Returns the length of the snake (the number of body parts).
      Returns:
      the length of the snake

    • getDirection

      public Point getDirection()
      Returns the current direction of the snake.
      Returns:
      the current direction as a Point object (x, y)

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Point newDirection)
      Sets the direction of the snake to the given point. The direction is represented as a point (x, y), where x and y can be -1, 0, or 1.
      Parameters:
      newDirection - the new direction the snake should move in

    • move

      public void move(Point direction)
      Moves the snake in the current direction by adding a new head in front of the current head and removing the last part of the body. This simulates the snake's movement on the board.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which the snake should move

    • grow

      public void grow(Point direction)
      Makes the snake grow by adding a new head in the current direction. This method is called when the snake eats food, and it increases the snake's length.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which the snake should grow
